resetLocalDataTitle: Deletes own ID, all chats and keys.
noOtherIdMessage: Your contact needs to message you before you can start messaging.
keyAlmostEmptyMessage: Your sending key is almost exhausted
refillKeyMessage: Refill it in person with your contact to send messages.
name: Name
whatIsYourPart: What is your part? It doesn't matter who does what.
scanQrCodesOfYourContact: Scan QR codes of your contact:
codesLeftToScan: All codes scanned | Just one code left | {n} codes left to scan
scanStatusInsecureContextError: Page is not served over HTTPS or localhost.
scanStatusNotReadableError: Maybe camera is already in use.
scanStatusOverconstrainedError: Did you request the front camera although there is none?
scanStatusStreamApiNotSupportedError: Browser seems to be lacking features.
qrCodeBelongsToAnotherSeries: This QR code belongs to another series.
enterChatNameMessage: Please enter the name of your contact.
vapidPublicKeyNotInResponse: Public VAPID key not in response.
pushNotificationsGrantedMessage: Permission allowed – it can be denied via browser notification settings.
pushNotificationsDeniedMessage: Permission denied – it can be allowed via browser notification settings.
deleteAllMessagesLocallyTitle: Sure you want to delete all messages in this chat?
notificationPermissionNotSupported: Push notifications are not supported by this browser environment.
notificationPermissionNotSupportedIos: Open Vernam in Safari on iOS 16.4+, select "Add to Home Screen" in the sharing sheet to add Vernam to your home screen and open it from there as app.
notificationPermissionNotSupportedAndroi: Open Vernam in Chrome Version 50+, select "Add to Home screen" in the menu to add Vernam to your home screen and open it from there as app.
notificationPermissionNotSupportedOther: Open Vernam in Safari on your iPhone or Chrome on your Android device.
introText: Vernam is no ordinary messenger app. To exchange messages with a contact, you must meet in person and load a shared random key. Each time you send a message, part of the key is used once to encrypt the message. This guarantees perfect end-to-end encryption, which is even more secure than conventional messengers such as Signal, WhatsApp or Telegram.
